channel.title: Need help || Trying to host two sources
channel.description: Does anyone know how to host two sources with 1 vps?

item.title: Need help || Trying to host two sources
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:483499”][quote author=lNS0MNlA link=topic=601733.msg4219667#msg4219667 date=1360648495]
Does anyone know how to host two sources with 1 vps?
[/quote]
Have one on port 5555, the other on port 43594.[/quote]

if it doesn’t let you, get off this forums.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help || Trying to host two sources

item.title: Need help || Trying to host two sources
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

If you’re using a VPS, the ports should already be portforwarded. You just need to add the ports to the firewall. Like sk8r said, use ports 43594 and 5555 or 43593.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help || Trying to host two sources
